reason.raw: This contribution was moved to pull request #141
reason.html: This contribution was moved to pull request #141

description.raw:
Contributing a tool/tutorial for controlling the atlas via joint commands.

The tool is a combination of the ROS joint state publisher:

http://www.ros.org/wiki/joint_state_publisher

(which publishes sensor_msgs/JointState messages)

And the python Atlas tutorial:
http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/drcsim/2.0/Atlas_control_over_ROS_topics_with_python

It populates a list of joint angles, then with scrollbars allows them to be set and then published as a osrf_msgs::JointCommand message.

... so the user can change individual joints and see the output from gazebo.

Could this be added to the list of tutorials and maintained. (My previous version of this was broken when the API changed)
http://people.csail.mit.edu/mfallon/share/2013feb/joint_gui/joint_command_gui.png
